job_title: Mental Health Technician in Buffalo, NY
pros: Working. Hour lunch (if there is enough staff). Overtime pay.
cons: Not enough staff, other staff sitting around at the desk. Union is crap, does not fight for employees. HR is worthless, only for business not staff. They never respond to employees and outright lie to them. They never provide correct food for diet restrictions. They often run out of things like milk, juice, towels, blankets, pillows. Eric P. couldn't care less about staff. Staff is often changing, huge turnaround. They have lost excellent, caring staff due to over work, poor work environment and other reasons

pros: I get to work with a lot of passionate and nice people. We get overtime pay, which is the bare minimum but still a good thing.
cons: This company suffers from a lack of staff, and the people who suffer the most are the employees. We are always overloaded with work because the workload can't be distributed effectively given the lack of people. We are simply outnumbered by the overwhelming tasks! A lot of us go home exhausted every work day, and some are on the brink of burnout already. Passion is not enough to push us because our physical bodies have their limits.

pros: I enjoyed my time working at Brylin and found my job satisfying for the most part. It seems they are trying to make it better for the employees by giving some more significant pay raises this year. If you're looking to get experience in Psych, it's a good place for that.
cons: Like a lot of places, you will work short-staffed at times. There are a lot of changes happening now, as the management as well as floor nurse turnover is high at the moment.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Buffalo, NY
pros: Genuinely passionate, intelligent colleagues who are committed to the welfare and progress of the clientele.
cons: BryLin leadership suffers from a lack of diversity and lack of insight into the daily realities of providing mental healthcare. It is alarming that BryLin is closing the outpatient clinic and suddenly laying-off a large team of clinicians while leaving their clientele scrambling to transfer care when community clinics have lengthy waitlists. I can only imagine the lack of financial responsibility it took to not be able to keep a mental health clinic in business while demand for mental health services has never been higher. This is a leadership team that didn't need to leave a large number of mental health service consumers feeling abandoned and ambivalent about ever trusting another treatment provider again... but they opted for that choice.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Buffalo, NY
pros: Hour long lunch (if you get one)
cons:
The company does not protect their employees, they do NOT care if patients attack you. Staffing ratios are poor, but still follow their “grid” which even their DON thinks is awful. You get left alone with agitated, abusive patients. Ask for help with an agitated patient and other staff straight out ignores you. Insurance is INSANELY expensive. They tell you that you get a sign on bonus but they never remember to pay it out. The union is useless, the reps just ignore you most of the time if you ask them for help. They say they have a “no retaliation” policy for filing reports, but I filed a report and within a month they found a reason to fire me. And the union did nothing. Staff is manipulative and very clique-y. The owner, Mr. Pleskow sits at home and watches everyone on the security cameras. He only cares about money and not staff or patients. 
Good luck!
Administration , Staffing issues, Incompetent workers, Disorganized higher ups

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Buffalo, NY
pros: BryLin has some of the highest quality, caring staff a psychiatric hospital could ask for.  Pay is reasonable.  Provides insight to private psychiatric care priorities.
cons: BryLin does not focus enough on retention of quality staff.  Does not focus on necessary education of sub par staff.  Responsibility on unit falls to the staff who go the extra mile--burn out among direct care team is high for this reason.  No feeling of job security--more focus is placed on blaming than problem solving and prevention.  Unprofessional gossiping from some in higher positions about floor staff.  This Psychiatric Hospital is in desperate need of more psychology classes.
